statements.text: Frodo Baggins inherits The One Ring in The Shire under Gandalf's wary guidance.
Samwise Gamgee leaves The Shire with Frodo Baggins, trusting Gandalf and The Fellowship of the Ring.
Gandalf confronts Saruman in Isengard while Sauron stretches his will from Mordor toward The One Ring.
Aragorn first guards Frodo Baggins in Bree before leading The Fellowship of the Ring toward Rivendell.
At Rivendell, Elrond gathers Gandalf, Aragorn and others to form The Fellowship of the Ring.
Legolas and Gimli join Aragorn in The Fellowship of the Ring, setting aside ancient grievances.
Boromir seeks The One Ring for Gondor, distrusting Aragorn's claim and fearing Mordor's encroaching power.
The Fellowship of the Ring crosses the Mines of Moria, where Gandalf confronts shadow before falling.
In Lothlórien, Galadriel tests the hearts of Frodo Baggins, Boromir and Aragorn beside the Mirror.
Samwise Gamgee vows in Lothlórien to follow Frodo Baggins even toward Mordor and Mount Doom.
After Amon Hen, Aragorn chooses to defend Merry and Pippin while Frodo Baggins slips toward Mordor.
Samwise Gamgee rescues Frodo Baggins from orc captivity near Cirith Ungol on the road to Mordor.
Gollum trails Frodo Baggins and Samwise Gamgee, torn between serving The One Ring and seeking freedom.
Frodo Baggins spares Gollum repeatedly, a mercy Gandalf once urged in Rivendell and The Shire.
Gollum guides Frodo Baggins and Samwise Gamgee through the Dead Marshes toward Mordor and the Black Gate.
In Ithilien, Faramir of Gondor questions Frodo Baggins, Samwise Gamgee and Gollum about The One Ring.
Aragorn, Legolas and Gimli pursue the orcs across Rohan, defending both Gondor and The Fellowship of the Ring.
Éomer of Rohan aids Aragorn, Legolas and Gimli after banishment by the corrupted king in Meduseld.
At Helm's Deep, Aragorn and King Théoden defend Rohan while Gandalf rides for scattered riders.
Saruman assaults Rohan from Isengard until Ents led by Treebeard flood his works at Isengard.
Aragorn travels the Paths of the Dead, summoning the Oathbreakers to aid Gondor against Mordor.
In Minas Tirith, Denethor despairs over Gondor as Sauron directs armies from Mordor against the city.
Pippin serves Denethor in Minas Tirith, while Gandalf organizes Gondor's defenses against Mordor's assault.
Rohan rides to relieve Minas Tirith, where Éowyn and Merry confront the Lord of the Nazgûl.
The Witch-king, mightiest of the Nazgûl, falls before Éowyn and Merry outside Minas Tirith's walls.
Aragorn arrives at Minas Tirith with the Grey Company, healing Faramir and Éowyn using kingsfoil.
In the Last Debate, Aragorn, Gandalf and Éomer decide to march on Mordor's Black Gate.
Sauron focuses his gaze on Aragorn at the Black Gate, unaware Frodo Baggins nears Mount Doom.
Near Mount Doom, Gollum attacks Frodo Baggins and Samwise Gamgee, driven mad by The One Ring.
At the Cracks of Doom, Gollum seizes The One Ring before tumbling into the fiery chasm.
With The One Ring destroyed, Sauron falls and Mordor's towers collapse before Gondor and Rohan.
After Sauron's fall, Aragorn is crowned in Minas Tirith as King of Gondor and Arnor.
In Minas Tirith's courts, Frodo Baggins and Samwise Gamgee are honored by Aragorn and the people.
Legolas and Gimli vow friendship beyond the war, visiting Rohan and Gondor as free companions.
Galadriel returns West after Sauron's fall, leaving Lothlórien slowly fading from Middle-earth's history.
In The Shire, Frodo Baggins struggles with wounds and memories despite The One Ring's destruction.
Samwise Gamgee tends gardens in The Shire, carrying Galadriel's gift and hope from Lothlórien.
Gandalf departs with Frodo Baggins from the Grey Havens, leaving Middle-earth to Aragorn and others.
The One Ring corrupts Gollum, Boromir and even Frodo Baggins, magnifying desire and hidden weakness.
The Nazgûl hunt relentlessly for The One Ring across The Shire, Bree and the wild lands.
Mordor's darkness spreads over Gondor and Rohan, challenging Aragorn, Gandalf and The Fellowship of the Ring.
Rivendell shelters broken heroes like Frodo Baggins before they journey again toward Mordor or The Shire.
Lothlórien offers light and song to Aragorn, Legolas and Gimli amid encroaching shadows from Mordor.
Gondor guards the frontiers near Mordor, while Rohan shields open plains with swift riders.
Minas Tirith stands as Gondor's white city, watching Mordor's mountains and the Eye of Sauron.
Mount Doom looms within Mordor, the only forge hot enough to unmake The One Ring.
The Fellowship of the Ring scatters across Rohan, Gondor and Mordor yet remains bound by purpose.
Aragorn accepts his heritage in Gondor, guided by Gandalf and strengthened by The Fellowship of the Ring.
Sauron never fully understands the loyalty between Frodo Baggins and Samwise Gamgee in Mordor's desolation.
Saruman underestimates Hobbits from The Shire, focusing instead on Rohan, Gondor and Isengard's engines.
Gollum fears both Sauron and Mordor, yet covets The One Ring above safety.
The Nazgûl fall only when Sauron and The One Ring finally perish together.
Rohan's horse-lords answer Gondor's beacons, riding through night toward Minas Tirith's burning fields.
Gondor's stewards hold power until Aragorn claims the throne after Sauron's defeat in Mordor.
In Rivendell, Elrond counsels Aragorn about Gondor, Arwen and burdens carried since Isildur's failure.
Galadriel encourages Frodo Baggins in Lothlórien, hinting at paths beyond Mordor and The Shire.
Minas Tirith and Edoras symbolize Gondor and Rohan, twin bastions against Sauron and Mordor.
Mount Doom's eruptions signal Sauron's rage, shaking Mordor as Frodo Baggins draws painfully nearer.
The Fellowship of the Ring begins in Rivendell but finds its echo later in Minas Tirith.
Gandalf's wisdom guides The Fellowship of the Ring through Moria, Rohan and Gondor's darkest choices.
The One Ring tempts Aragorn in Lothlórien, yet he returns it unclaimed to Frodo Baggins.
Samwise Gamgee resists The One Ring briefly in Cirith Ungol before returning it to Frodo Baggins.
Sauron shapes the Nazgûl with power from The One Ring and the lesser Rings of Power.
Saruman studies Rings of Power in Orthanc, dreaming of rivaling Sauron using his own devices.
Galadriel refuses The One Ring in Lothlórien, choosing to diminish rather than rule Middle-earth.
The Nazgûl scatter when flood-waves at the Ford of Bruinen destroy their mounts near Rivendell.
Rivendell, Lothlórien and The Shire represent havens where The One Ring briefly finds uneasy rest.
Mordor's borders press against Gondor and Ithilien, where Rangers secretly watch Sauron's roads.
Rohan's royal house suffers corruption from Saruman, until Gandalf frees King Théoden beside Meduseld's hall.
Gondor's beacon-fires summon Rohan's aid, linking the fates of Minas Tirith and Edoras.
Minas Tirith resists siege engines from Mordor while the Nazgûl scream overhead, spreading terror.
Mount Doom's fires finally consume The One Ring, ending Sauron's visible power in Mordor.
The Fellowship of the Ring leaves lasting friendships among Aragorn, Legolas, Gimli and the Hobbits.
Gandalf entrusts The Shire to Samwise Gamgee, Pippin and Merry after Frodo Baggins sails West.
The One Ring's memory haunts Frodo Baggins, even amid The Shire's simple peace and green fields.
Sauron's fall lets Gondor rebuild cities while Rohan restores pastures, guarding against future threats.
Saruman, stripped of power, wanders bitterly, his failed alliance with Sauron echoing through ruined Isengard.
Gollum's twisted loyalty to The One Ring ultimately ensures its destruction inside Mount Doom.
The Nazgûl's terror lingers in songs across Gondor and Rohan long after Sauron's defeat.
Rohan and Gondor honor the dead of Helm's Deep and Minas Tirith in shared remembrance.
Rivendell's libraries preserve records of Sauron, Isildur and Rings of Power for later ages.
Lothlórien's fading woods remind Legolas and Gimli that even elven realms pass as Ages change.
Gondor's renewed White Tree symbolizes hope as Aragorn rules justly with Arwen in Minas Tirith.
Minas Tirith and The Shire feel distant worlds, yet Frodo Baggins walks between them both.
Mount Doom, Mordor and The One Ring become cautionary tales told quietly in The Shire.
The Fellowship of the Ring becomes legend in Gondor, Rohan, Rivendell and distant corners of Middle-earth.
Gandalf's departure marks the end of the Third Age for The Shire and all Free Peoples.
The One Ring's forging by Sauron in Mordor reshaped history for Gondor and the West.
Sauron's watchful Eye over Mordor never considers mercy like that shown by Frodo Baggins.
Saruman's fall warns Gondor and Rohan that wisdom without humility leads toward Sauron's shadow.
